unique_users: AFOSR, Air Force Office of Scientific Research

citation.abstract: A metal-elastomer-foam composite that varies in stiffness, that can change shape and store shape memory, that self-heals, and that welds into monolithic structures from smaller components is presented.
citation.title: Morphing Metal and Elastomer Bicontinuous Foams for Reversible Stiffness, Shape Memory, and Self-Healing Soft Machines

news.title: Morphing Metal Shapes Future of Soft Robotics
news.summary: TEHRAN (FNA)- Engineers created a hybrid material featuring stiff metal and soft, porous rubber foam that combines the best properties of both -- stiffness when it's called for, and elasticity when a change of shape is required.

news.title: Metal Foams Hold Promise Of New Technologies And Protection
news.summary: Metal foams are strong enough to stop armor-piercing bullets, while being light, flame- and heat-resistant, and they can block many forms of radiation.

news.title: Shape-Shifting Drones Could Be Made from Metal-Foam Hybrid
news.summary: Miniature drones that can morph from flying machines into underwater vehicles by changing the shape of their wings in midair could be a step closer, thanks to a new material that acts as a hybrid between stiff metal and spongy foam.

news.title: Shape-Shifting Drones Could Be Made from Metal-Foam Hybrid
